I was proud to vote today for the #FAIRAct, which eliminates the false choice Americans are currently subjected to, & restores the private arbitration system to its original intent – providing a *voluntary* alternative process for resolving disputes & restoring access to justice.

None of the safeguards of our judicial system apply to the arbitration process. No real judge, no jury, & no right to appeal. It’s a closed process, allowing businesses to avoid accountability for disputes involving sexual harassment, discrimination, & unsafe work conditions.

84% of voters from both sides of the aisle oppose forced arbitration. Americans understand just how unfair it is – yet many consumers don’t know that it’s often a pre-condition for cell phone contracts, credit card applications, and even employment.

Millions of consumers and workers are impacted by forced arbitration, which bars people from suing companies in federal court – instead forcing victims to pursue this private dispute resolution method that almost always favors the companies. https://www.minnpost.com/community-voices/2019/08/access-to-the-courts-minnesota-delegation-should-support-the-fair-act/ …

Food wrappers, plastic bags, & plastic bottles are found in marine environments, including in our wildlife refuges. To fix this global problem, it will require all of us working together to improve coastal waste management & devise creative mitigation solutions.

The use of plastic rapidly expanded after WWII, and is a major part of our daily lives. Microplastic contamination is now so pervasive, it’s in every ecosystem & has been found even in remote locations.

Marine debris is a global issue. Watch at 10:30am ET/9:30am CT as we examine the impact of marine debris on habitats, wildlife, and humans, and efforts to prevent this problem from getting worse:  https://youtu.be/1zI84LG2qv0  pic.twitter.com/4p5SzRUPKw

As a member of the Appropriations subcommittee that oversees the FDA, I’ve been working to address youth e-cigarette usage, which the Surgeon General has deemed an "epidemic." I’m also proud to support HR 2411 – which raises the age to buy tobacco, including e-cigarettes – to 21.

According to the 2017 MN Youth Tobacco Survey, “nearly 20% of high-school students use e-cigarettes and 40% have tried them.” We have no idea what the long-term effects of these devices are. The Antideficiency Act exists to protect Congress’ power of the purse. 

The law says an agency may not switch to a different appropriation merely because the one it chose first is now depleted. This is known as the “pick and stick rule.” Pick one and stick to it. pic.twitter.com/y5YI5AvKTm – at Rayburn House Office Building

I have serious questions about Acting Sec. Bernhardt’s decision to use visitor fees to keep some national parks open during the shutdown. These funds are not a slush fund for the Administration to use whenever and however it wants.

Our most fundamental responsibility is to exercise Congress’ power of the purse, as entrusted by the U.S. Constitution. As appropriators, we take this role seriously to ensure taxpayer dollars are handled properly. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o19UKauoqbc …

National park visitor fees are for a very specific use – long-term capital improvement projects. They are not general obligation funds to pay employees or pay for routine maintenance. https://www.wyomingpublicmedia.org/post/democrats-hold-hearing-scrutinizing-funding-national-parks-during-shutdown#stream/0 …

House Democrats are also committed to making sure the economy works for everyone – not just those at the top. We passed legislation to raise the minimum wage & ensure equal pay for equal work, and ensure retirement security for seniors through the #ButchLewisAct.

The House passed #HR3, which expands the services Medicare covers & addresses the skyrocketing cost of prescriptions – like insulin, which has seen a 197% cost increase. We're working to #LowerDrugCosts & reduce out-of-pocket medical expenses #ForThePeople.

The House also approved additional legislation to safeguard our elections, the #SHIELDAct & SAFEAct. We also passed #HR4 to expand protections for voters under the #VotingRightsAct, after a Supreme Court decision removed many of these protections in 2013.
In the face of a culture of corruption embraced by Pres. Trump & the GOP, the House passed #HR1—the #ForThePeople Act—to restore and strengthen our democracy & elections.

The crisis of climate change has been top of mind. We passed #HR9, which would prevent Mr. Trump from pulling the U.S. out of the Paris Climate Agreement. I joined @SpeakerPelosi at #COP25 to send a message to the rest of the world: #WeAreStillIn.  https://bit.ly/2Mba6gv

The House also passed #HR8 to help address gun violence from another angle – strengthening background checks for gun purchases to keep guns out of the hands of those who shouldn’t have them. We’re committed to keep fighting to end this epidemic.

As a member of @AppropsDems, I’m proud that for the first time in decades, funding has been appropriated for gun violence research – treating it as the public health crisis it is. We took action because thoughts & prayers simply aren’t enough. pic.twitter.com/iBnNy8N4eZ
.@HouseDemocrats fought hard to ensure all 12 appropriations bills make investments that reflect our Democratic priorities: to #ProtectOurCare, #ActOnClimate, #EndGunViolence, and more.

In our state, we have a long tradition of caring for our environment. These Minnesota leaders have valuable tips for all of us so we can remain national leaders in recycling: http://www.startribune.com/how-you-can-help-minnesota-recycle/564882762/ …

But in addition to our work in Congress, we also need an administration that’s willing to promote recycling, not polluters: https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2019/nov/14/america-recycles-day-plastic-pollution-cover …

I’ve also signed on as a co-sponsor of my colleague @Ilhan’s legislation, the #ZeroWasteAct, promoting zero-waste practices to help reduce the overall amount of trash & recyclables and alleviate pressures on the system.

Congress has recognized the need to promote a comprehensive strategy. I led the FY20 @AppropsDems Interior-Environment bill, which directs @EPA to create a #NationalRecyclingStrategy to develop nationwide labeling standards.

Today is #AmericaRecyclesDay.

Recycling is so important – but it’s facing crisis in America because of the absence of a national strategy.
